intro: Stachys fontqueri, commonly known as the Sierra grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and open woodlands. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in spikes and are usually pink to purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Stachys fontqueri is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
